captions.text:
this week and every day we're sticking
Dana 60's under a little orange Jeep and
bring it to the mecca of off-roading
Moab Utah
so last year my buddy Tony
flew out from

Michigan to help me work on the Jeep
that we were getting built for Mohab  last year that
TJ

tube sock and he want to come back
out this year and help me out on the

project called on this JK which can be a
lot easier project and the TJ was

than I think he wanna get outta Michigan
where its probably really cold and snowy
right now
so imma run over to the airport to pick him up go get some work done on this jeep
Tony how are ya
dude really come on get in
here hand me your bag
I understand now why you told me to pack light
yeah you brought a lot of stuff
where just working working on a jeep O really yeah
what's up with this

O the viper yeah I borrowed it from the road
kill guys
lets go work on a jeep lets go work on a jeep I like that

so if you've been in a off roading at
all you heard of Dana axles
Dana 44's Dana 30's
and this is a Dana 60 well Dana

has come into the aftermarket axle world
they've always made axles for the OEM's

but now they're offering aftermarket
axle that you can buy

and bold into your jeep we have a front
Dana 60 and a rear Dana 60 never gonna
put into
are crazy double and a jeep here these

axle bolt right into a JK they have all
the stock mounts they have all the brake

lines they have all the speed sensors
everything ready to go

fortunately our JK is a little bit
different than stock
bring her down backup
down with your bad self this Jeep

as you can tell it's kind of unusual
what you can see is we took a stock two
door JK a couple years ago

cut it in half and grafted another front
and on the back in the Jeep the reason

we did that was the one to build
something really unusual that everybody
would notice

we also want to put rear steer on the
Jeep at the time going with these Dana
axles were removing the rear steer

but when we built that jeep we actually
dovetail the whole frame in an added a
front frame section to the back

of the original to door JK so all of 
the suspension mounts are a little bit
different
then a stock JK so

Rob got the Dana sixty over there he's cutting
off the stock brackets

those brackets would usually bolt right
into a JK of course our JK is
difference Mike is working on the front

he is getting the front axle over there
and that's gonna bolt right in

as you can see from a lot of these links
mounts they're all scratched up from
drugged over rocks

so the rear suspension is now going to
be a three link with a track bar

that means we have to mount the
center link

on their rear Dana 60 that Rob is working
usually J K has  a four link and a track
bar

so we're gonna put an axle truss on it
and now the rear upper link on the top

of that axle truss we got an axle truss
from Artec

and we're going to use some of the
synergy manufacturing parts like
steering components

and maybe some some pole brackets some
shock mounts

to make that rear axle bolt right into
our crazy double ended JK

we gotta get to work cus we gotta be on the road
to Moab
in 4 days

Tony come here let me show you how
to hurdle

this axle there are a few hurdles are
running into with this axle

not specifically how tall is but the pinion
is longer than the spider tracks axle that we
had in here

so the drive shaft is gonna have to be
shortened we also need to set the pinion
angle because it is not a CV driveshaft

it's the 1350 joined either end in order
to do that

we needed to drop the drive shaft so we
can measure the output

up the transfer case angle verses the
bottom of the frame rail

then we'll set the pinion angle the same
here and make

the spring perches parallel to the bottom
of the frame rail while pinion is parallel
to the output of the transfer case

I 1.5 degree so we're pretty pretty
doggone good

i mean it could be it could be a little better something in here gonna
have to twist
and Rob will fix all that that's Rob's Robblem
its my robblem
it's all my robblem

while Mike's buttoning up the front lights  he's
gonna be painting
and

basically final assembly on the front I
have one more link rack tack on and
then cycle the suspension fully

and then I can poll housing outta here
and fully weld all the brackets that are
on here I probably have in about an hour

welding to do on this housing once
that's all done
then we can paint put it back in

plum the brakes finish up a little bit a
wire we gotta do
and then were there more or less

so remember the Alabama army truck when we bolted on 
these 40 inch Pro Comps and then we broke
transmission

well that truck is still sitting on my
shop

in pieces waiting to get fixed so
we're stealing the tires off of it to put on the
orange jeep to go to Mohab
got it
I got it

we're gonna bolt these forties on you rock paper
scissors
yes 1-2- 3 shoot 1 23 shoot
1 23 shoot i win

I'll put on the lugnuts you put on a tire see
that's how it works
you got this yeah
any second now right

this is my lawyer i lawyer to come all
the way out here to help put on lugnuts

it's probably gonna cost me like a thousand dollars an
hour to have him
why don't we just lower the jeep down
no no cus that'll be sensible

here we really only need three that's a hundred
dollars
thanks get outta here lawyer

after fourteen some hours of driving we
finally made it my favorite little red
rock town in Utah

Mohab unfortunately Tony couldn't make it
out with us on the very first trail ride

so took the little orange jeep out  by
myself to see how the new axles would
hold up
we are on the 4 wheel parts run

we're taken our JK we got the Dana
Altman Dana 60's underneath it

the guys some synergy helped us out Tom
Woods came through at the end of the day
and got us some

awesome drive shafts their bolted in
we're gonna catch up with the group we're gonna 4 wheeling

we're gonna see where a little jeep will
do now it's brand new axles
and big 40 inch Pro Comp tires
I love Mohab
every year the guys from 4 wheel parts put on

trail ride on for the invite all the
companies that

make parts that they sell through 4 wheel parts for parts
so it was kinda fun to go along this
year

see all the different brands whether
it's

like off road lighting company or
winches or tires

so they're all out here and they're having
lunch

going 4 wheeling  together it's
interesting because this off road
industry everybody
works together year-round

but then the to be able to come out
here to Mohab go 4 wheeling with all the people
you work with
it's always a good time plus

not only all the industry folks out here
there's hundreds and hundreds of jeepers
come from all over America come here 4 wheeling

and these JK Wranglers are just blowing
up those things are

all over the place now used to CJ's and
then it was YJ's and
TJ's and when the four-door

Jeep Wrangler came out back in 07 people
like

those will never work off road they're too big
no one's gonna want that

now that's like one short wheelbase Jeep
for every
eight long wheelbase 4-door Jeep
so
it's pretty amazing

there so capable to have enough
wheelbase
and enough power

their great for rock crawling pretty they're
really comfortable you can take your wife
kids with you
turn on the air conditioning
how you guys doing having fun

this is Randolph from Dana Spicer making
Dana axles for

how long since the nineteen hundreds
we've been putting axles underneath

Jeep since the Jeep came out of the car company a
that's true

jeep has always had a Dana axle so those
axles that we put in the little orange jeep

front and rear Dana 60 high pinion low
pinion rear
lockers gears the whole deal chrome shafts

how much for that you're ready to
go you're probably gonna pay
11 9 for the complete set ready to go

they drop out bolt in yeah if you're if
you're bolting it in a stock JK

they're gonna go right in ours was a
little bit more work but because we
always do crazy stuff

lockers are working great we've been
rock crawling out here

how's your jeep holding up you guys have
60's under that we have the ultimate Dana 60's
underneath our JK

that's pretty good stuff I like coming
out Mohab I like working with

other guys that have been making cool
parts for a long time
lets go get in our jeeps and go 4 wheeling  let's go

if you're new to off raoding may be asking
why you should upgrade to bigger Dana 60
axles

the short answers larger axles allow you
to run larger tires

and thus try harder off road obstacles and
do it all the sense of security

that you'll get home safely more of
course anything can be broken with
enough abuse

the stepping up to Dana 60's with
lockers and gears

over the stock Dana 30 and 44 axles in a
Wrangler

let you enjoy harder terrain the type
stuff you find
all over Mohab
do to do to do
keep it moving

this place is so awesome it's my
favorite small-town in America

there's awesome four wheeling and
there's

epic scenery that is why we come to Moab
every year

we'll see you next time on dirt
everyday

title: Moab Jeep Axle Adventure! - Dirt Every Day Ep. 38

comments.author: Anthony32656

comments.text:
Hey! Me and my dad can't wait until we can take is yj jeep to Moab. We 
still have several things left to do on it but instead of starting to work 
on it again he bought me a 56 ford f100 for my 15th b-day and we have been 
working on it for a couple months now. My dad has owed his jeep has had his 
jeep longer than he had had any other car and has driven it less than any 
other car. When we finish my truck it will be another year at least before 
we will be able to work on it. But as soon as we're done we will most 
likely go to Moab!﻿

comments.author: artsohc

comments.text:
Fred. I'm sorry but going from spider 9's to crate dana 60's was a 
downgrade in my book. The ford 9" is a stronger dif,  more steering angle 
with the Spidertrax knuckles, less weight and rear steer.
I do understand that the crate 60's would make a good upgrade for the Jeep 
guy with tons of cash to burn. But shame to show how to do on such a unique 
vehicle.﻿
